div.p: During training in security what they do is they teach you the basics, they teach you the knowledge just like everything else
you know when you’re out there on the streets you’ve got to put the knowledge together with the experience so they didn’t really teach
you the worldly widely things you know out there, you know where you may be dealing with people that may, unfortunately, have
a drinking problem or somebody that may have a drug addiction and somebody that really needs to feed that and they go and they do
things they shouldn’t be doing like shoplifting so your approach to them you learn on the job, you know, the way you’ve got to talk
to the individual, the way you stand in front of the individual, your body language, everything it’s from experience, it’s great in a classroom
when you’re told about A, B and C but when you get out there there’s always a D and you learn that on the ground.
